snippet: Eric J. Snyder of Brooklyn said the language being used on the November ballot question was slanted because it mentioned positive legislative purposes.
abstract: Brooklyn lawyer Eric J Snyder files suit seeking to stop November referendum that would allow more casinos across New York State; argues ballot measure’s language is improperly slanted in favor of its passage;  wording of referendum has also rankled some government watchdog groups, which see it as one-sided.
lead_paragraph: Eric J. Snyder of Brooklyn said the language being used on the November ballot question was slanted because it mentioned positive legislative purposes.

headline.print_headline: Lawyer, Suing, Sees Slant in Casino Referendum’s Wording
